Here's one way people act on social media that is actually much better than in person. (Apologies if this post made you hungry) Sharing. It's as simple as that. If one of your friends gets a promotion, in the real world, you wouldn't rush to tell all your other friends, "Hey, look! This person you don't know got a promotion!" But on social media, sharing such news is not just common; it's encouraged. It's baked into the system. Their growth helps you grow. Value for their community, is value for yours. It's a unique aspect of digital connectivity that amplifies positive news and accomplishments far beyond our immediate circles. I really don't get the spin that social media is negative and toxic. I remember 4 TV channels and 'the news' 3 times a day. Wasn't so long a go. Now that was over 99% negativity. P.S. If you do find keeping up with the online world a distraction and draining. You don't need to miss out on the growth opportunities. At Brand Around You we will grow your personal brand while you focus on your business or spend time with your kids. Do you think social media is more negative than the 'real-world?'

Let's ask a basic question: Why are we all on Social media? âœ¨ï¸How much of it is contributing to my growth and wellbeing? âœ¨ï¸How is it impacting me negatively? Is all the information overload worth? There may be a thousand statistics and industry leaders telling you that "This is the way" "That's how you'll grow". But just pause a moment and ask yourself, What is growth for you? Choose your spaces wisely.

I went from 1K to 100K followers in 100 days!! You can do it too â¬‡ NO, I DID NOT! Not all of us are dedicated to growing our followers at god speed. Not all of us have the ability to be as consistent as others. Not all of us know exactly what we want to pursue. Not all of us want to dedicate our lives to LinkedIn. Not all of us can comment on 25 posts per day. Not all of us are copying other creators. A few of us come and go. A few of us are still figuring it out. A few of us are trying and growing slowly. A few of us just want to find work on LinkedIn. A few of us donâ€™t know what weâ€™re doing out here. A few of us donâ€™t care about the number of followers. We out here exploring, learning, and slowly growing. AND THAT IS COMPLETELY OKAY! Iâ€™m someone who was so focused on follower count a while ago just because sooo many LinkedIn creators were shoving it on our faces. But it doesnâ€™t matter. Slow growth is still growth. Keep exploring. Keep learning. Thanks for coming to my TED talk! ğŸ’›

Are you using social media properly or you're just scrolling mindlessly? You know itâ€™s not bringing you any good, but you still spend your precious time here. I used to do the same for the last 8 years. Not learning anything new. Not doing something productive. Just aimless scrolling throughout the day. But things have changed since I used this hack. Now I mostly learn from social media. And help others learn as well. How? By engaging with otherâ€™s content. A simple explanation for this would be- When you just read something, you retain 10% of its knowledge. But when you read, demonstrate, and discuss, you retain 75% of the knowledge. The easiest way to do this is by commenting. - on what youâ€™ve learned - on your perspective - on your knowledge It not only helps you gain knowledge but also helps others learn as well. Whatever your thought is, just go ahead and comment. Your words have the power to help someone be better. P.S. How do you use LinkedIn for your growth?
